results.title: New Support for Some Extinct Tasmanian Tiger Sightings
results.abstract: The last thylacine died in captivity in 1936, but a statistical analysis adds a degree of validity to the survival of small groups of the carnivorous marsupials.

media.caption: The last known Tasmanian tiger died in captivity in 1936. But a study suggests hundreds more sightings into the 20th century.

results.title: New Batch of Classified Documents Appears on Social Media Sites
results.abstract: Secret documents that appear to detail American national security secrets on Ukraine, the Middle East and China have surfaced online.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: The leaked documents come as Ukraine has been preparing for a spring offensive as part of an effort to reclaim territory in the east and the south of the country.

results.title: E.P.A. Is Said to Propose Rules Meant to Drive Up Electric Car Sales Tenfold
results.abstract: In what would be the nation’s most ambitious climate regulation, the proposal is designed to ensure that electric cars make up the majority of new U.S. auto sales by 2032.

media.caption: President Biden delivered a speech at a General Motors electric vehicle assembly plant in Detroit in 2021. The new rules would exceed his earlier goal that half the cars sold in the United States be all-electric by 2030.

results.title: Justice Thomas Says He Was Advised Lavish Gifts Did Not Need to Be Reported
results.abstract: In a statement, the justice said that he had followed past guidance from others at the court, but that he would now comply with new guidelines and disclose gifts and free travel.

media.caption: Justice Clarence Thomas said that he “was advised that this sort of personal hospitality from close personal friends, who did not have business before the court, was not reportable.”
